title: Extension block callback
text: extension block callback run block context, part blockr.dock. blockr.dock exposes generic, namely extension_block_callback(). blockr extension, like blockr.dag, can provide method.

what: Add badge status to DAG nodes
title: Extension block callback
text: motivation behind mechanism update node state according block status change. instance, block needs incoming data incoming connections, may want display error badge node. error occurs block execution, display badge. extension_block_callback() DAG method returns function following signature: x extension object. id block id. board board object. update contains reactive values describing board current actions. conditions contains reactive values return list conditions associated block state. dag_extension extension instance. returned extension bottom main server function: callback need get DAG proxy object containing correct namespace, allows update DAG another module. session current block session, different namespace DAG extension. callback function returns NULL.
code: list(   state = list(     graph = reactive(       input[[paste0(graph_id(), "-state")]]     )   ),   proxy = proxy ) extension_block_callback.dag_extension <- function(x, ...) {   function(     id,     board,     update,     conditions,     dag_extension,     ...,     session = get_session()   ) {     n_cnd <- reactive(       sum(lengths(conditions()$error))     )      badge_count <- reactiveVal(0L)      observeEvent(       req(n_cnd() > 0L, n_cnd() != badge_count()),       {         n <- n_cnd()          badge <- list(           text = "",           placement = "right-top",           backgroundFill = "#dc2626",           stroke = "#fff",           lineWidth = 2,           padding = c(5, 5)         )          node_config <- list(           list(             id = to_g6_node_id(id),             style = list(               badges = list(badge)             )           )         )          g6_update_nodes(dag_extension$proxy, node_config)         badge_count(n)       }     )      observeEvent(       req(n_cnd() == 0L, badge_count() > 0L),       {         node_config <- list(           list(             id = to_g6_node_id(id),             style = list(               badges = list()             )           )         )          g6_update_nodes(dag_extension$proxy, node_config)         badge_count(0L)       }     )      NULL   } }

title: blockr.dag
text: create empty board blockr.dock serve new_dag_extension() extension: can also start custom graph structure:
code: # Create an empty board. serve(new_dock_board(extensions = new_dag_extension())) graph <- new_graph(   nodes = list(     list(id = 1),     list(id = 2)   ),   edges = list(     list(       source = 1,       target = 2,       style = list(labelText = "1-2")     )   ) )  serve(   new_dock_board(     extensions = new_dag_extension(graph)   ) )

title: blockr.dag
text: create empty board blockr.dock serve new_dag_extension() extension:
code: # Create an empty board. serve(new_dock_board(extensions = new_dag_extension()))

title: blockr.dag
text: can also start custom graph structure:
code: graph <- new_graph(   nodes = list(     list(id = 1),     list(id = 2)   ),   edges = list(     list(       source = 1,       target = 2,       style = list(labelText = "1-2")     )   ) )  serve(   new_dock_board(     extensions = new_dag_extension(graph)   ) )

title: blockr.dag
text: Shift + Drag: Create connections blocks. Ctrl + Backspace: Remove selected elements. Alt/Option(Mac) + Drag: Multi-select elements.

title: blockr.dag
text: Shift + Drag: Create connections blocks. Ctrl + Backspace: Remove selected elements. Alt/Option(Mac) + Drag: Multi-select elements.

title: blockr.dag
text: blockr ecosystem, blockr.dag high level extension usually comes end stack. depends blockr.core core functionalities blockr.dock user interface. also relies external packages like g6R rendering interaction, well extra block packages like blockr.dplyr blockr.ggplot additional block types:     Server-side observers handle state synchronization block.core board g6R output. update board inherited blockr.core: update composed : listen update() apply necessary changes g6R widget via proxy functions:
code: graph TD     subgraph Core Layer         blockr.core[blockr.core]     end      subgraph Extension Blocks         blockr.dplyr[blockr.dplyr]         blockr.ggplot[blockr.ggplot]     end      subgraph UI Layer         blockr.dock[blockr.dock]         blockr.dag[blockr.dag]     end      subgraph External Dependencies         dockViewR[dockViewR]         g6R[g6R]     end      blockr.core --> blockr.dock     blockr.dock --> blockr.dag     dockViewR --> blockr.dock     g6R --> blockr.dag      blockr.core --> blockr.dplyr     blockr.core --> blockr.ggplot      blockr.dplyr -.-> blockr.dock     blockr.dplyr -.-> blockr.dag     blockr.ggplot -.-> blockr.dock     blockr.ggplot -.-> blockr.dag # Update observer handles board changes update_observer <- function(update, board, proxy) {   observeEvent(update(), {     upd <- update()      if (length(upd$blocks$add)) {       add_nodes(upd$blocks$add, board$board, proxy)     }      if (length(upd$stacks$mod)) {       update_combos(upd$stacks$mod, board$board, proxy)     }      # Handle other update types...   }) }

title: blockr.dag
text: blockr ecosystem, blockr.dag high level extension usually comes end stack. depends blockr.core core functionalities blockr.dock user interface. also relies external packages like g6R rendering interaction, well extra block packages like blockr.dplyr blockr.ggplot additional block types:
code: graph TD     subgraph Core Layer         blockr.core[blockr.core]     end      subgraph Extension Blocks         blockr.dplyr[blockr.dplyr]         blockr.ggplot[blockr.ggplot]     end      subgraph UI Layer         blockr.dock[blockr.dock]         blockr.dag[blockr.dag]     end      subgraph External Dependencies         dockViewR[dockViewR]         g6R[g6R]     end      blockr.core --> blockr.dock     blockr.dock --> blockr.dag     dockViewR --> blockr.dock     g6R --> blockr.dag      blockr.core --> blockr.dplyr     blockr.core --> blockr.ggplot      blockr.dplyr -.-> blockr.dock     blockr.dplyr -.-> blockr.dag     blockr.ggplot -.-> blockr.dock     blockr.ggplot -.-> blockr.dag

title: blockr.dag
text: Server-side observers handle state synchronization block.core board g6R output. update board inherited blockr.core: update composed : listen update() apply necessary changes g6R widget via proxy functions:
code: # Update observer handles board changes update_observer <- function(update, board, proxy) {   observeEvent(update(), {     upd <- update()      if (length(upd$blocks$add)) {       add_nodes(upd$blocks$add, board$board, proxy)     }      if (length(upd$stacks$mod)) {       update_combos(upd$stacks$mod, board$board, proxy)     }      # Handle other update types...   }) }

title: Context Menu Items
text: Context menu items created new_context_menu_entry(): js can string representing JavaScript function R function takes namespace ns input returns string: condition either boolean R function takes board target (clicked element) input returns TRUE FALSE determine entry shown. new entry go inside context_menu_items.dag_extension registration:
code: # Context menu entry entry <- new_context_menu_entry(   name = "Custom Action",   js = function(ns) "alert('Custom action')",   action = function(board, update, ...) {     # Server-side logic   },   condition = function(board, target) {     target$type == "node"   } ) function(ns) {   sprintf(     "(value, target, current) => {       Shiny.setInputValue('%s', true, {priority: 'event'});     }",     ns("add_block")   ) } # Add custom context menu items to an extension context_menu_items.dag_extension <- function(x) {   list(     new_context_menu_entry(       name = "My Action",       js = function(ns) {         sprintf("Shiny.setInputValue('%s', true)", ns("my_action"))       },       action = my_custom_action("my_action"),       condition = function(board, target) TRUE     )   ) }

title: Toolbar Items
text: toolbar includes several default operations: Zoom /- Navigate large workflows. Auto fit - Fit entire graph view. Layout - Reset graph layout. Add block - Trigger create new blocks. Add stack - Trigger create stack. Remove selected - Delete selected elements (can stacks, blocks links)

title: Toolbar Items
text: Toolbar items declared via new_toolbar_item(): js can string representing JavaScript function R function takes namespace ns input returns string: new item go inside toolbar_items.dag_extension registration:
code: # Toolbar item item <- new_toolbar_item(   id = "custom_tool",   icon = "icon-custom",   js = "console.log('Custom tool clicked')",   action = function(board, update, ...) {     # Server-side logic   } ) function(ns) {   sprintf(     "(value, target, current) => {       Shiny.setInputValue('%s', true, {priority: 'event'});     }",     ns("add_block")   ) } toolbar_items.dag_extension <- function(x) {   list(     item   )

title: Authors and Citation

title: Authors and Citation
text: Granjon D, Bennett N, Sax C (2025). blockr.dag: Directed Acyclic Graph Extension 'blockr'. R package version 0.1.0, https://bristolmyerssquibb.github.io/blockr.dag/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {blockr.dag: A Directed Acyclic Graph Extension for 'blockr'},   author = {David Granjon and Nicolas Bennett and Christoph Sax},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://bristolmyerssquibb.github.io/blockr.dag/}, }

title: A Directed Acyclic Graph Extension for blockr
text: interative network library provided g6R can used front-end blockr board using package.

title: A Directed Acyclic Graph Extension for blockr
text: can install development version blockr.dag GitHub :

title: A Directed Acyclic Graph Extension for blockr
text: start board dag extension, run following code: Note demo runs shinylive. feature may work expected due compatibility issues webR.
code: library(blockr.dag) library(blockr.core) library(blockr.dock)  options(   "g6R.mode" = "dev",   #"g6R.layout_on_data_change" = TRUE,   "g6R.preserve_elements_position" = TRUE )  serve(   new_dock_board(     blocks = c(       a = new_dataset_block("iris"),       b = new_scatter_block(x = "Sepal.Length", y = "Sepal.Width")     ),     links = list(from = "a", to = "b", input = "data"),     stacks = c(       stack_1 = new_dock_stack(c("a", "b"), color = "#0000FF"),       stack_2 = new_dock_stack()     ),     extensions = new_dag_extension()   ) )

title: Context menu functions — new_context_menu_entry
text: Functions creating working context menu entries.

title: Context menu functions — new_context_menu_entry
code: new_context_menu_entry(   name,   js,   action = NULL,   condition = TRUE,   id = tolower(gsub(" +", "_", name)) )  is_context_menu_entry(x)  context_menu_items(x)

title: Context menu functions — new_context_menu_entry
text: name Name context menu entry. js JavaScript code execute entry selected. action Action perform entry selected. condition Condition determine entry shown. id Unique identifier context menu entry. Inferred name provided x Object

title: Context menu functions — new_context_menu_entry
text: new_context_menu_entry() context menu entry object class "context_menu_entry" containing condition, action, js functions, name id attributes. is_context_menu_entry() TRUE x context menu entry, FALSE otherwise. context_menu_items() list context menu items given object.

title: Context menu functions — new_context_menu_entry
text: new_context_menu_entry() Creates new context menu entry specified name, JavaScript code, action function, display condition. is_context_menu_entry() Tests whether object valid context menu entry. context_menu_items() Generic function extract context menu items various objects like dock extensions, boards, lists. context_menu_items.dag_extension() method provides following actions: Create link - Creates connections workflow nodes. Remove block - Removes individual blocks workflow. Remove link - Removes connections workflow nodes. Append block - Adds new block selected node. Create stack - Creates new workflow stack. Remove stack - Removes entire workflow stack. Edit stack - Opens stack editing interface. Add block - Adds new block canvas.

title: DAG extension — new_dag_extension
text: Visualizes DAG (directed acyclic graph) underlying board provides UI elements manipulate board.

title: DAG extension — new_dag_extension
text: graph graph object (NULL). ... Forwarded blockr.dock::new_dock_extension().

title: DAG extension — new_dag_extension
text: dag_extension object extends dock extension system visualizing manipulating DAG workflows.

text: R list-based representation g6 graph object.

title: Graph object — new_graph
code: new_graph(nodes = list(), edges = list(), combos = list())  is_graph(x)  graph_nodes(x)  graph_edges(x)  graph_combos(x)  as_graph(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'graph' as_graph(x, ...)  # S3 method for class 'list' as_graph(x, ...)

title: Graph object — new_graph
text: nodes Graph nodes (.e. board blocks). edges Graph edges (.e. board links). combos Node groups (.e. board stacks). x Object test convert. ... Generic consistency.

title: Graph object — new_graph
text: new_graph() graph object class "graph" containing nodes, edges, combos lists. is_graph() TRUE x graph object, FALSE otherwise. graph_nodes() list graph nodes. graph_edges() list graph edges. graph_combos() list graph combos (node groups). as_graph() graph object converted input.

title: Graph object — new_graph
text: new_graph() Creates new graph object specified nodes, edges, combos. is_graph() Tests whether object valid graph object. graph_nodes() Extracts nodes component graph object. graph_edges() Extracts edges component graph object. graph_combos() Extracts combos component graph object. as_graph() Generic function convert objects graph format.

title: Toolbar item functions — new_toolbar_item
text: Functions creating working toolbar items DAG interface.

title: Toolbar item functions — new_toolbar_item
code: new_toolbar_item(id, icon, js, action = NULL, tooltip = NULL)  is_toolbar_item(x)  toolbar_items(x)

title: Toolbar item functions — new_toolbar_item
text: id Unique identifier toolbar item. icon Name icon show toolbar. js JavaScript code execute entry selected. action Action perform entry selected. tooltip Optional tooltip text entry. x Object

title: Toolbar item functions — new_toolbar_item
text: new_toolbar_item() toolbar item object class "toolbar_item" containing action js functions, id, icon, tooltip attributes. is_toolbar_item() TRUE x toolbar item, FALSE otherwise. toolbar_items() list toolbar items given object.

title: Toolbar item functions — new_toolbar_item
text: new_toolbar_item() Creates new toolbar item specified id, icon, JavaScript code, action function, tooltip text. is_toolbar_item() Tests whether object valid toolbar item. toolbar_items() Generic function extract toolbar items various objects like dock extensions, boards, lists. toolbar_items.dag_extension() method provides following actions: Zoom - Increases graph zoom level. Zoom - Decreases graph zoom level. Auto fit - Automatically fits entire graph within viewport. Layout - Reapplies graph layout algorithm reorganize nodes. Add block - Opens interface add new block workflow. Add stack - Creates new workflow stack. Remove selected - Removes currently selected elements graph.

title: blockr.dag 0.1.0
text: Initial CRAN submission.
